content: ETF Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 08 Nov 2018Should I create a CDP account if I already have a Stanchart custodian account? Is there any charges or minimum trades a month for the CDP to keep it? Also, when should I sell off an ETF?4 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (4)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Yong Kah HweeLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 11 Nov 2018I think there is no harm in creating a CDP account. You lose nothing, except for a bit of time which is used for application process. No charges nor minimum trades! 0 comments0

Charmaine Lim XiaomeiLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 10 Nov 2018I think it boils down to the type of investment you are looking at. You can refer to this article here that lists the pros and cons of CDP vs Custodian: https://blog.seedly.sg/cdp-vs-custodian-account/Moreover, there is no requirement for min trades with CDP and you can leave your account untouched with no charges! Therefore, I think you should open an account even if you have no use for it now because it will take approx 2-3 weeks for your application to be approved!0 comments0

Yixiong ChangLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 08 Nov 2018Yes u should just create a CDP account. There are no charges no maintain. You will need it in future, eg if u want to apply for public ipo or bonds, like the just past temasek bond offering or any other ipo thru ibank/atm. 0 comments0
Lim Tian ShangLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 08 Nov 2018Is good to open a CDP account. It is completely free and there is no maintenance charges.0 comments0
